item.title: Algorithms and Data Structures
item.author: Author
item.description: Dynamic Programming Greedy Algorithms References Dynamic Programming The two key ingredients: optimal substructure: The optimal solution contains the optimal solutions to subproblems. The subproblems need to be independent, which means the solution to one subproblem does not affect the solution to another subproblem. overlapping subproblems The other two steps: Reconstruct an optimal solution Memoization: When the subproblem is first encountered as the recursive algorithm unfolds, its solution is computed and then stored in the stable.
